I'm just talking about the Marvel Cinematic Universe V the DCEU. This isn't including anything that isn't apart of the MCU or DCEU. So while I absolutely adore The Dark Knight trilogy, it, thankfully, has no bearing on the DCEU (MoS, BvS, Suicide Squad).
So if I compare the first three MCU movies (Iron Man, Incredible Hulk, and Iron Man 2) versus the first three DCEU movies (Man of Steel, Batman V Superman, Suicide Squad) the Marvel movies are CLEARLY, better movies, because they make sense, they're not overly long, and they have charismatic characters.
To be honest, I'm having a little trouble tracking your train of thought because you keep bringing up The Dark Knight Trilogy as if it's related to the BvS universe, when it is in fact not. So I'm not sure if you think I have a problem with TDK trilogy, because I don't. Those are great movies, and are on a different level than the MCU movies.

Eh, I'll take formulaic Marvel films that are coherent movies over the current crop of poorly conceived DC movies designed to be "different" from the Marvel stuff, but wind up turning into poor imitations.
Anyway, sorry to derail your thread. Those DCEU figures are nice, but I just can separate them from the source material.
Just make the next Wolverine Laura. In a few years Dafne Keen will look old enough to pal around with the X-Men from last years film.

Iron Man 2 has it's problems, but at the very least it's got wildly entertaining performances by the cast. BvS had a bunch of dudes brooding, a bad script, a convoluted plot, and a bloated runtime. The worst thing I could say about Iron Man 2 is that being forced to expand the MCU handicapped what could have been a great Iron Man sequel. Thankfully they rectified that with Iron Man 3.
Pretty much based on the movies being critical failures. I've seen BvS twice, the theatrical cut and extended edition, and I thought it was awful on both counts.
The BvS figures included make it more like Avengers, legends of DC Comics and the cautionary tales of DC Comics.
